snippet: Dr. Millar oversaw the training, deployment and support of dozens of health workers in some 20 countries in Africa in the 1960s when the disease remained an urgent international health concern.
abstract: Dr J Donald Millar, a physician and former public heath official who helped eradicate smallpox on an international scale, dies at age 81.
lead_paragraph: Dr. Millar oversaw the training, deployment and support of dozens of health workers in some 20 countries in Africa in the 1960s when the disease remained an urgent international health concern.

headline.main: Dr. J. Donald Millar, 81, Dies; Led C.D.C. Mission That Helped Eradicate Smallpox
headline.print_headline: Dr. J. Donald Millar, 81; Led C.D.C. Mission That Helped Eradicate Smallpox

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
